questions.prompt: How many U.S. Presidents have been assassinated while serving as President?
questions.answer: Four - Abraham Lincoln, James Garfield, William McKinley and John F. Kennedy

questions.prompt: Lev is the currency of which country?
At which ground did Kapil Dev score his iconic 175* in the 1983 Cricket World Cup?
questions.answer: The Nevill Ground at Tunbridge Wells

questions.prompt: What were the names of the two policies enacted by Mikhail Gorbachev to reform the Soviet Union which eventually led to the end of the Cold War?
What two elements is Jupiter made of?
What is Gavrilo Princip notorious for in the 20th century?
questions.answer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand

questions.prompt: Who is the only person to receive a Noble Prize in two different fields?
Who won the First Battle of Panipat?
Which U.S. president promised to land on the moon before the end of the decade, "not because it is easy but because it is hard"?
The Durand Line is the border between which two countries?
What is the highest mountain peak in India?
questions.notes: Third highest in the world after Everest and K2

questions.prompt: Danzig is the old name for which Polish city which was one of the first places attacked during World War 2?
The Entente Cordial forms the basis of the current foreign relations between which two countries?
Name any one of the two now suspended trains between India and Pakistan.
Which tube line(s) can you take from Bayswater?
Name 10 countries that share land borders with Russia.
questions.answer: Norway, Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Belarus, Ukraine, Mongolia, China, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Poland, Lithuania

questions.prompt: Which is the largest European country without a railway network?
Who scored the winning goal in the 2014 FIFA World Cup final?
Which movie won the Filmfare award for best movie in 1976?
What is the sum of the first 999 natural numbers

I'm thinking of a secret whole number between 1 and 1,000 — inclusive. You're allowed to ask yes-or-no questions, but only of the form: "Is your number greater than X?" What is the smallest number of questions you would ever need to guarantee you can find my number, no matter what it is?
Which two Zone 1 stations in London have direct connections to 3 different London airports?
Which American celebrity is incorrectly thought to have helped in bringing down the Berlin Wall?
questions.notes: He did perform there in 1989 but the wall came down due to political changes in East Germany

questions.prompt: In which movie did Amitabh Bachchan say the famous dialogue "Hum jahan khade hote hain, line wahin se shuru hoti hai"?
In which year did U.S. President Richard Nixon end the direct convertibility of the U.S. Dollar to gold, effectively removing the United States from the Gold Standard?
The airport code OTP is used for the capital of which European country?
What is the new name of the London Overground line from Watford Junction to Euston?
In which year was the first iPhone launched?
What bird deity serves as Lord Vishnu's mount?
F1 cars drive upside down in some simulations - what property of the car makes that theoretically possible?
questions.answer: High downforce - the downforce is more than the weight of the car

questions.prompt: The Øresund Bridge, which is partly below the ocean and partly above, links which two cities?
In Japanese cuisine, what does the word "unagi" refer to?
What is the name of the phenomenon that explains the change in pitch of a passing siren?
Who was the first Indian woman to serve as President of the Indian National Congress?
questions.notes: Annie Besant was the first woman overall (1917); Naidu was the first Indian woman (1925).

questions.prompt: Name two out of the three bowlers who have taken all 10 wickets in a single Test innings.
questions.answer: Jim Laker, Anil Kumble, Ajaz Patel

questions.prompt: Who led the East India Company's forces at the Battle of Plassey (1757) which established British Rule in India?

What is the scientific name for the blood cells that primarily carry oxygen in humans?
Which Romanian song by a Moldovian band does David Guetta sample in this song?
What conflict is sung about in this song by The Cranberries?
Name one member of this band.
questions.answer: *NSYNC - JC Chasez, Justin Timberlake, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone, Lance Bass
questions.notes: Bye Bye Bye by *NSYNC - The group is named after the last letter of each of the members' first names but Jason dropped out and was replaced by Lance

questions.prompt: Which movie is the dialogue "Babumoshai, zindagi badi honi chahiye, lambi nahin"?
Ceviche is most closely associated with which country?
Who are "the few" referred to in the famous quote "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few"?
questions.answer: Royal Air Force pilots in the Battle of Britain
questions.notes: The quote is by Winston Churchill
